characters: WE BEGIN TO HEAR A LOW INSISTENT BEEPING...
HE SCREAMS IN HORRIFYING PAIN, FADING OVER INTO...
"SURFACE SUPPORT VESSELS TO YOUR LOCATION ETA
THE LOUD, HARD CHOPPING OF A HELICOPTER PROPELLER
WE HEAR FOOTSTEPS COME FROM DOWN THE HALL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fog hangs above the street, amongst the streetlamps.  Apa buildings line the curb, it is very quiet.  In one buildi up, a bedroom light is on.  WE SEE the silhouette of Norm looking out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of a crash was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You seen my suitcase?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing on the news about a crash.  Did he say what airline?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He didn't say much at all.  Honey --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the closet.  I don't understand, Norman -- why would they call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so supportive, honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I can't imagine five years of unemployment --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four.  Four years --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four years of unemployment would look too good on a resume.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep watching the news.  Are you watching the news?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you getting to the airport? You need money for the bus? A tinted-window black SEDAN travels down the street, pull of the apartment building.  A U.S.  NAVY decal is on the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a U.S.  Navy car outside, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was it a military crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They never used to send a Navy car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blinding sunlight, as the helicopter WHIPS by, speeding a Pacific Ocean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, 53, disheveled, unshaven, sits in the back.  He s pamphlet in his hand: "AIRCRASH SURVIVAL: HOW TO COPE". the cockpit, turns to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kinda work you in, Dr. Johnson? Norman quickly stuffs the pamphlet into his dufflebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in psychology.  Was.  Still am really, just been a while. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I treat aircrash survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so you're that Dr. Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've heard of me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, everybody's been talking about that report you wrote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean you don't know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what? The pilot glances back at him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be another Johnson then.  Been flying so many scientists out here -- can't keep everyone straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's everyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Physicists, mathematicians, geologists, you name it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geologists?  At a plane crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, isn't it?  In the middle of the ocean no less.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell would a geologist be doing at a plane crash? Norman looks out the window and sees a group of ships cir water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter descends down onto the helipad, wind gusti young, female OFFICER -- holding her hat to her head -- r greet Norman, as he climbs out of the helicopter. She looks down crudely at his shotty, nylon dufflebag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any other bags, Dr. Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that.  Careful, it's heavy. She lugs it over her shoulder, no problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No other equipment?  Scientific instruments?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, they didn't say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, sir. Norman follows the officer away from the helipad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leads Norman down a flight of stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Barnes wants to see you right away, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes.  He's very eager to meet you. Been calling us every half hour to see if you're arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? As they march down a hallway, Norman looks down at his wr tries to smooth it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way sir, I've read your report.  I think it's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean they haven't told you yet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told me what? She staightens up, like she might have said too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This way, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAPTAIN HAROLD BARNES, 60s, immaculate, proud of who he i the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he look?...  Well, we can't all be officers, can we? (laughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They tell me he's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman stands in front of the door.  The doorplate reads: COMMANDER -- CAPTAIN HAROLD BARNES.  Norman straightens h tie.  Deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the door opens, Barnes is putting down the phone, rise desk, as Norman steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Norman Johnson.  Welcome aboard. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Colonel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.  Right, forgive me. Barnes looks at Norman, sizing him up.  An akward silence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for the opportuninty here -- my wife appreciates it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't thank me, Dr. Johnson.  You weren't my choice.  The Pentagon made me take you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pentagon?  I didn't know I had friends in Washington. Norman tries to laugh as Barnes ushers him to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come with me.  The team's already waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes leads Norman down the corridor, lined with OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What have you been told so far?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The usual.  Plane crash.  Survivers unknown.  Routine stuff really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing else. A GUARD unlocks a large, steel door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Barnes.  Dr. Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello. Norman looks at the guard as they proceed through the doo wondering how the guard knows his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talk to any reporters?  Any press?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Press?  No, I haven't. The steel door shuts loudly behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good.  Security's been our biggest worry.  Now that you're here we can shut this thing down tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?  What's with all the security?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we don't have all the facts yet. Another GUARD opens up another large steel door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes leads Norman through the room, crammed with video screens, and grids.  Officers talk into radios.  Technici computers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving fast considering the storm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Storm?  What storm?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cyclone's on it's way in.  I thought they would have told you on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They didn't tell me anything. Norman tries to keep pace...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've had divers working around the clock.  Take a look at this... ANGLE ON a large VIDEO SCREEN -- shows a diver walking on floor, holding a bright artificial flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How deep is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A thousand?  An airplane crashes into a thousand feet of water -- I don't want to sound pessimistic here, but I assume there are no survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Survivors?  No, I wouldn't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need me for? ON THE VIDEO SCREEN -- the diver shines his light on a la OBJECT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What crashed wasn't an airplane, Dr. Johnson.  It's a bit larger than that. Barnes walks toward a TECHNICIAN, sitting at a keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to technician)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring up the grid, would you? ANGLE ON THE MONITOR as an IMAGE OF THE CRAFT begins to f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?  A military spacecraft? Like a shuttle or satellite?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't surprise you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, no.  Something of the military crashes in the ocean -- it explains why there was nothing on the news, why you've kept everything a secret...  When did it crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As best we can estimate, it crashed four hundred years ago. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four hundred?  You're kidding, right? ANGLE ON THE MONITOR -- showing a grid depicting an image and a small layer of ROCK above it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See this?  Coral.  Geologists measured the coral growth on top of the craft to be over five meters thick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geologists?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coral grows at a rate of two and a half centimeters a year --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Wait a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- dating the crash at least that old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe older --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- there's got to be some mistake here -- a four hundred year old military spacecraft?  There's no such thing... our space program isn't even forty years old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Extraordinary, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm afraid it is Dr. Johnson... because it's sitting on the bottom of our ocean floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes and Norman shuffle down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the record, I don't mind telling you, this thing scares the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We think it might.  That's why we brought you here.  We've assembled your team -- they're waiting for us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What team?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one you recommended.  In the ULF report you wrote for the Bush administration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ULF report?  Nobody's mentioned that in years.  You mean someone actually read it? As they head down a hallway, Barnes pulls the ULF REPORT under his arm, hands it to Norman. Norman looks at it, almost embarrassed to be holding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your report's become our bible down here, Dr. Johnson.  We've been carrying out each of your recommendations -- one by one -- to the smallest detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, I don't understand.  This report -- these recommendations... they're for an encounter with extra- terrestrial life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A VIDEO SCREEN -- sonar video of the spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How big is this spacecraft?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of what we're able to measure, roughly twenty-six hundred feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A half a mile long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wing dimension alone is larger that any aircraft we've seen. The team members sit around the conference table: TED FIELDING, 41, geologist, boyish and happy to be here. HALPERIN, 36, biochemist, mother of three who's never wor ARTHUR LEVINE, 54, marine biologist, pudgy and quiet.  HA mathamatician, African-American, wire-glasses, no bullshi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much damage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the craft?  None.  Not a scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  So you're saying it survived a high speed impact with water without a scratch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not saying anything, Harry, I'm just stating the facts. (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outer metal is made of a titanium alloy, built into an epoxy- resin honeycomb.  The necessary technology to bond this type of metal has never been invented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never invented? ON NORMAN, watching the team...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In basic English, what does all this mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basic English?  There's no way this spacecraft was constructed on our planet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large, X-Ray APPARATUS moves to the side, revealing Nor ON BETH -- standing next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five years.  No phone calls.  What am I -- a leper? Norman sits up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, look, can I trust you with a little secret?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ULF report everybody's patting me on the back about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've read it twice, Norman.  It's brilliant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bullshit.  The report's a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's quite a secret.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a week reading Sagan and watching re-runs of the Twilight Zone.  Seriously.  I was just trying to pay the mortgage on my house -- I had no idea -- ANGLE ON TWO NAVY CORPSMEN, standing behind glass in the monitoring Beth and Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do yourself a favor, Norman.  Are you listening?  Don't tell anyone what you just told me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Beth -- that report's like the blind leading the blind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because when we get down there --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait -- down where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To the spacecraft.  To investigate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Underwater?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect?  For them to bring it up here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't go down there.  We're not prepared.  That deep?  That takes years of training, Beth.  We're just scientists.  Lab scietists.  We wear ties and lab coats to work -- not oxygen tanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you must have realized the chances an encounter like this would happen here.  In the ocean. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 percent of the earth's surface is water, Norman.  That's first grade geography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It never occurred to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let's pray that's the only mistake you made.  Have you said anything to Barnes about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The timing has never seemed quite right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keep your mouth shut, alright? This could mean everything to our careers, you know that?  Don't jeopardize this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous laughter)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- are you threatening me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SKY -- clouds looming on the horizon. ANGLE ON ARTHUR LEVINE, leaning against the railing, look the water. ON NORMAN, approaching him.  Arthur never looks at Norman stares out at the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know you, but I'll be honest with you.  I don't like this.  I don't like any of this.  Especially, the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seasick?  A marine biologist?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't belong here.  None of us belong here.  Look at that. ANGLE ON THE WATER, an ocean of seemingly endless, choppy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes you feel pretty small, doesn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It scares the shit out of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NORMAN, lying on a cot.  It is dark.  His eyes a stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A porthole hatch to the DESCENT SUB unlatches loudly.  A help Norman lower himself through the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman steps down the ladder into the sub compartment.  S circle area: Ted, Beth, Harry, and Arthur.  Ahead of them Barnes sits with the pilot in the sub's cockpit, separate of plexiglass. Norman takes a seat between Beth and Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our descent will take 13 minutes. Descending at a speed of 80 feet per minute. Across from Norman, Harry is WHISPERING something quietly Arthur's ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pressure adjustments will cause the sub to lurch at times, but don't be alarmed.  It's perfectly normal... Arthur's face drips with sweat, as Harry continues to whi ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub's interior atmosphere will experience moisture as we descend, and the temperature will drop rapidly.  Just relax and remain seated during the descent. Norman watches Arthur, dripping with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have clearing from the base. Red interior lights flicker on in the compartment, and WE make a HISSING sound.  The sub lurches, and begins to low water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur? Harry has gotten to Arthur.  Arthur is on the verge of pa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur?  You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the hatch door, please. Harry continues to whisper in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, open the hatch door, please ... the hatch door, Captain.  Open it, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Dr. Levine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me out, Captain.  Open the door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Dr. Levine. Arthur leaps violently out of his seat, scrambles to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through the plexiglass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Dr. Levine!  You're in a military operation now -- Arthur bangs on the plexiglass wall with his fists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Your civil rights have been overridden!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open it, Captain!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Levine, please!  Return to your seat! Arthur VOMITS, violently, heaving, splattering the plexig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open the fucking door! The sub LURCHES again, coming to a stop.  The compartment silent, as they begin ascending to the surface. ON HARRY smiling a sly, evil grin directed right at Norma The sub lurches again, and WE HEAR clanking metal.  The h opens. And Arthur, wiping the vomit from his mouth, climbs up th out the hatch door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody else? Silence. The hatch door LOCKS, loudly.  The sub lurches, and begin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pussy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that -- mistake number two, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a pussy. Harry is still staring at Norman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are you feeling, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You holding up alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.  I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not being defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sound defensive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say to him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To who?  Arthur?  Nothing.  Nothing that Norman doesn't already know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does Norman already know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman thinks we shouldn't be going down.  Thinks it's a mistake. Norman looks over at Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me what you said, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just one of Norman's many secrets. ON NORMAN, saying nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE the sub descending into darker waters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUB descends into the AIRLOCK, metal clanks against m it, the DH-8: interwoven cylinders lit up with lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE HATCH DOOR closing tightly, locking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One moment for pressurizing. A SOFT WHIRR. ANGLE ON -- Barnes and the four remaining team members st small, claustrophobic pressurizing room.  Like sardines. anything.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR
dialogues.text: in front of them, opens.  TEENY FLETCHER, 30s, a big-bone officer, stands before them.  She wears a black plastic P "talker", around her neck. She hands each member their own "talker".  Norman takes h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher leads Barnes and the team members down the hallw them wears the "talkers" around their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pressurize us with helium.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with oxygen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a corrosive gas.  On earth, it makes a half-eaten apple turn brown and puts the ugly, iron rust on an Oldsmobile.  At a pressure this low, oxygen becomes toxic.  Breathe it down here, and it'll do to your dick what it does to the Oldsmobile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Important safety tip.  Thanks Captain. Fletcher listens through her radio earpiece, turns to Bar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, the divers have the airlock mounted at the door.  The robot is now in position to enter the spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robot?  What robot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MONITOR -- showing the robot in front of the c metal of the spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, bring up the robot's camera feed. JANE EDMUNDS, 32, the unit archivist, works the control p MONITOR clicks on -- showing the robot's POV of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, you know, I really appreciate you hauling us a thousand feet below sea level so we can watch this historical event on television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody goes inside, until we know what's inside. ON THE MONITOR -- THE ROBOT CAMERA scans the spacecraft h a rectangular panel mounted to the left of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you open that panel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working on it now, sir. ON THE MONITOR -- a robotic CLAW extends out to the panel pry the panel open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like it noted in the report that I think we should be doing this ourselves.  Making a manned entry... The claw is clumsy, and keeps banging into the metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd also like it noted --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duly noted, Ted.  Edmunds, try using suction. ON THE MONITOR -- another robotic arm extends out, with a sucker.  It pushes against the panel, but doesn't suck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not sucking, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, I can see that.  Try something else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have anything else to try, Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, shit -- find something, do something... make something up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a crowbar? Barnes straightens up, looks at Ted...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about a crowbar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if we go out there, you know -- wedge a crowbar in the door and pry the thing open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pry the thing open?  What are we -- neanderthals?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that banging and pounding.  I don't know.  We should think about making a good first impression.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For who?  The fish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For whoever's in that thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or whatever's in that thing. ON THE MONITOR -- the spacecraft, sitting there silently, at them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, what do you think? Norman, quiet in the corner, perks up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Well -- I don't really...  I mean, you could... you know, you could make a real solid case... a crowbar? All eyes on Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. A beat as they all stare at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm secure enough with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON A LOCKER door opening.  Inside is an elaborate J HELMET with the name: "JOHNSON", stenciled above the face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are we all -- I mean, is it necessary for all of us to go... out there? The other team members take their suits out of their lock

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing to be nervous about.  These suits are wired and electrically heated.  Each equipped with an alarm that triggers automatically if life- support sustems go below optimum. Norman holds his jumpsuit out and away from him, like it' nuclear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just like swimming, Norman... You know how to swim, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not afraid of the water, are you, Norman? They all look over at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half smiling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isn't there a psychological term for that, Dr. Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Drowning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed in jumpsuits and helmets -- Barnes jumps into a P water, cut out from the floor, leading to the ocean.  It tiny swimming pool.  Ted jumps in next.  Beth, Harry, and left...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're next, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous as hell)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Go ahead.  Really.  Ladies first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a gentlemen when you're scared shitless. She hops in.  Norman watches, looks up at Harry, next to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Ladies first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, why don't -- Harry nudges him forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second, I -- Harry pushes him again.  Norman catches himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geez, c'mon, alright.  Gimme a minute.  Let me get my bearings -- Harry pushes him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, would you -- And Harry just pushes him in.  Norman slips and falls awk the ocean depths.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK.
dialogues.text: Quiet.  Only THE SOUND OF NORMAN -- BREATHING. For a couple beats. Now... NORMAN'S POV -- from inside his helmet -- a light behind him -- casting his SHADOW onto the murky ocean flo Norman's head turns, and he's BLINDED by a light -- it's light SHINING from the top of Harry's helmet. WE HEAR Harry's voice, static, through Norman's helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The switch is on your waist. ON NORMAN -- his GLOVE -- fumbling at his waist. HIS HELMET LIGHT -- FLICKERS on. ON NORMAN -- slowly, beginning to walk on the ocean floor HIS FEET -- squashing gently, lightly into the muddy grou NORMAN'S POV -- can barely make out the others in front o helmet lights STROBING the dark water, crossing each othe searchlights on a foggy night. CLOSE ON NORMAN'S FACE -- eyes cold, BREATHING.  Couple b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that thing. Norman's eyes look up... WE PULL BACK... LONG, HIGH, WIDE SHOT of the team -- their little helmet and insignificant almost as... IN FRONT OF THEM -- the SPACECRAFT.  Dwarfing them in siz large, majestic, like nothing we've ever seen.  The enorm in the distance, extends high out of the coral. In the huge MOUND OF CORAL covering the spacecraft, WE SE cut out like a cave -- lined with tiny, dim lightbulbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About 60 feet deep.  Narrower than they'd like.  Norman d clumsily, awkwardly -- pushing off the bulky, iron handle the coral walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON NORMAN'S FACE as he watches the water recede, do faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: THE LOUD BANGING OF METAL
dialogues.text: Ted has wedged a crowbar into the door and BANGS at it wi sledgehammer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy Ted, we're not mining gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme some room here, will you?  Back off.  Gimme some space. They all back away, cramming into the far corner of the a keeps swinging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks alot like an airplane door, doesn't it? Ted stops and looks at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alot like.  You know, I noticed it before, but I didn't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shutup, Ted.  You didn't notice shit. Keep hammering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a 53 year old shrink, what are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the hammer, Ted. Norman takes the hammer.  Walks up to the wedge.  Gets hi Rears back... then stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, your back give out? Something has caught Norman's eye.  He looks down at the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look. Barnes comes toward him.  The others follow.  Barnes bend closely down at the wedge in the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's chipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chipped?  The door?  How can it be chipped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know how it can be chipped, but it's chipped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said there wasn't any damage done in the crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how can it be chipped? ON BETH -- she touches the door with her palms, feels aro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's heat coming the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back away then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you wait a minute?

dialogues.speaker: THE DOOR STARTS TO RUMBLE
dialogues.text: Barnes unstraps a GUN -- nearly the size of an uzzi -- fr buckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, get her away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do -- shoot her? The RUMBLING louder...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get her away! THE DOOR begins to slide open. Beth backs away. THE DOOR, sliding, is revealing COMPLETE BLACKNESS inside stops, it's open, it's quiet.  They all stand there, look BLACKNESS.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN -- cautiously stepping inside.  His helmet ligh others ahead of him, walking along a 5 foot wide CATWALK, high in the air. Metallic BEAMS and RAFTERS criss-cross above them. Norman looks over the railing -- his light STROBES throug darkness, dimly lighting the LOWER HULL, a dense network GIRDERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Ted SPOTLIGHTS the OUTER HULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some sort of lead or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Radiation shield, you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foot and a half thick?  That'd withstand a helluva lot of radiation. Beth's light SHINES down onto the CATWALK.  WE SEE FOOTPR on the dusty floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any of you get ahead of me -- walk this far up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, think.  Because there's footprints here that aren't mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, they're not mine. ON THE FOOTPRINTS -- large, like the boots they're wearin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, alright?  They gotta be somebody's here.  Let's stay together, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LONG SHOT -- seeing them suspended high in the air on the walking.  Their tiny streams of LIGHT moving about.  WE S ominous this spacecraft really is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's empty.  Why would someone build a ship like this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd have to ask them. They approach a DOOR, at the end of the catwalk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, Beth, do that thing you did before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about I just press the button? She presses a button near the door.  The door SLIDES open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or just... press the button. Barnes holds out his gun, and enters.  The others behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, isn't it?  You know -- how it would have a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earth doesn't have a patent on buttons, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still, make a note I recognized that. ON BARNES -- leading them through a small hall.  It seems up into some sort of room -- when Barnes stops.  Dead in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you make of this? ON NORMAN -- as he steps around Barnes, his light BRIGHTE SIGN that reads: "Trash."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Very softly, Harry begins to laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. Norman looks up and SEES more of the room as his light SH throughout it: TABLES, COUCHES and CHAIRS -- made of leat comfortable looking. They begin to slowly wander about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It doesn't make any sense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think it does?  I think it's rather obvious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it some sort of joke?  Like one of those hoaxes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A spacecraft half a mile long -- with 500 tonnes of coral on top of it?  Someone went to a lot of trouble.  Try again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it? Beth touches the table, it's metal, but it's soft and rub

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would this ship carry instructions in English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless, this alien spacecraft was -- you know -- somehow presenting itself to Americans in a way that would make us feel comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 400 years ago?  I'm sure Christopher Columbus would've loved these accomodations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good theory, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's your theory?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a woman.  I don't theorize.  I only deal with facts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the facts you need are right in front of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a minute here... I think I've got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is an alien spacecraft --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your breath.  It's not an alien spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an American spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An American spacecraft?  Half a mile long?  And buried 400 years?  Yeah, good theory, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been obvious from the start, hasn't it, Captain?  That's why all the secrecy, why no one was told about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We had considered it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Considered what?  That it's American? How would you think it's American?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chip in the door. ON NORMAN -- glancing up at Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take a weeny little wedge, bang on it a couple of times, and bust off a chunk of the metal.  Yet any spacecraft -- even at a low velocity, say 200 miles an hour -- crashes into the water -- it's gonna be like hitting concrete, it would crumple like paper.  But there isn't a dent to be seen anywhere.  Not even a scratch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning it didn't land in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  It must have flown here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It didn't fly here.  It arrived here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arrived?  From where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not where.  When.  400 years ago.  From our future. A quiet moment as they take this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted and Barnes trek through a vast cargo bay, like two an flashlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time travel.  I always thought it was one of those myths... like Santa's reindeer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would we be working on in the future that would make us want to come back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we didn't want to come back.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN
dialogues.text: Norman, Harry, and Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A light switch.  A button opened that door -- the craft runs on some sort of power. ON NORMAN -- as he sits down in one of the CHAIRS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that noise? They LISTEN to a GIRGLING NOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds a little like water -- SUDDENLY -- the chair Norman's in -- wraps around him, sq inside, padding sliding around his head, his shoulders en -- sucking him inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get this thing off me. Beth bends down, presses a button, the CHAIR releases Nor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think the chair thinks you want to fly this thing. ON BETH's FACEPLATE -- as she's looking down -- WE BEGIN reflected in her faceplate: yellow digital lettering sput across...

dialogues.speaker: "RV-LHOOQ... DCOM1... "
dialogues.text: Her EYES look up slowly... as we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BLACK SCREEN in front of the chairs, lit up with brig lettering: "RV -- LHOOQ -- DCOMl -- U.S.S STAR VOYAGER" "ASSIMILATING DATABASE" as a series of numbers race upwar count...  And the desk in front of them LIGHTS UP, a control panel life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever I can do to help. ON THE SCREEN as it changes, now filled with columns:

dialogues.speaker: FLIGHT RECORDS
dialogues.text: Harry punches some keys on the control panel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A flight recorder.  Our future is about to be seen in our present. ON THE SCREEN as it changes:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 01-01-47.  Two thousand-forty seven. 50 years in our future.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unknown Entry Event. Harry pauses, looks down, and punches more keys...  ON THE SCREEN -- as it expands in size, widens around the WE SEE a galaxy of stars, planets coming OFF THE SCREEN, room, becoming three dimensional, suspended in air, givin illusion of depth. The IMAGE begins streaking outward, TOWARD US, moving rap we're flying through it. The stars and other space matter streaking by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that cluster of stars there? In the center? Harry stares, walking around the desk, moving into the 3-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time travel.  A black hole. The CLUSTER of stars grows brighter and brighter, as it c and closer, brightening. The FIELD twists and turns as the SCREEN and FIELD become WE ENTER the cluster, the black hole. ON NORMAN -- his face, bright, FRIGHTENED as he HEARS:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?  Captain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know how this craft got here. Where it's been.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do we.  And it seems to have picked up something on it's travels. STILL ON NORMAN -- frightened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Picked up something?  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  But it's something alien.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON our six team members' BOOTS, in the distance.  A and AROUND WE SEE a curved surface appear: a surface of s swirling green and blue fluids.  Like mercury.  Mesmerizl AS WE COME AROUND, the team stands looking at the SPHERE, dlameter, held by a GIANT CLAW gripping it from the top. They walk around it, circling it, looking up at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This answers one of our questions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one?  Let me get the list out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This spacecraft was designed to pick things up.  They see things they want -- these claws go out and bring it in.  They come across this.  This...  sphere.  Find it interesting, curious.  They draw it inside to take back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But on the way home, they miss their turn, go too far, into the past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what does it do?  This... sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a message of some sort, you know?  See this red here. ANGLE ON THE SPHERE -- some dark red MARKINGS on it's sur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like a design, some writing, maybe.  Maybe it was sent to meet the spacecraft with a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look closely.  That isn't writing. Those are grooves. ON THE RED GROOVES -- engraved into the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  They don't represent a message. They aren't decorative at all.  They have another purpose entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To conceal a small break in the surface of the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A break for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN A LONG CORRIDOR -- WE SEE Barnes, through a half-clo pacing, talking on the phone...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it's definitely something alien ... another civilization, yes, sir...  Well, we don't know yet, but we think we've found a door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, Barnes, and the team members (minus Ted) look at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how do we get it open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted seems to have some ideas. ON THE MONITOR -- Ted pushing on the SPHERE door.  Bangin his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is alien, maybe we shouldn't try to open it at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding to Norman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man is man, all he knows is man, and all he can think of is what he knows.  The anthropomorphic problem. Good, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mentioned it in my report.  Didn't you read the report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything ever written about extra- terrestial life imagines that life is essentially human.  If it doesn't look human, it's a reptile or a big insect or something, having human values, human understanding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?  What's the problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's nonsense.  There's enough difference between our own species to prove that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take politics, our views on abortion, the death penalty...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cannibalism, to be extreme.  And now we're talking about a new life form. Their values and ethics may be incomprehensible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like "Thou shall not kill"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or maybe, it can't be killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, what's in that thing is immortal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.  That's the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything can be killed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not everything.  Even on earth.  Take ... yeasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeasts?  Thank you, Beth, but I don't think we're gonna open it up and find a loaf of bread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we're just talking about three- dimensional creatures.  What if it's five or six or seven-dimensional?  So dimensional that we couldn't even see it to kill it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good point.  I don't know what you're talking about, but good point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or it could contain some great benefit to us, some astonishing new idea or technology to help mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could.  But the odds of it being any use to us are against it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's say whoever made this thing is a thousand years ahead of us, just like we are to, say, medieval Europe.  Suppose you went back to medieval Europe with a TV set.  There wouldn't be any place to plug it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me worst case.  Worst case of what we might find?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could breathe in air and exhale cyanide gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Disrupt our brain waves, interfere with our ability to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Produce radioactive waste and disintegrate us into nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PRINTER, TYPING: "Surface winds at 25 knots -- E of Departure -- 01:45 hrs"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, sterile.  WE HEAR the repeating sound: THWAP.  Alm dripping faucet.  THWAP... THWAP...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry on his bunk, staring at the wall, flicking his midd his cheek: THWAP... THWAP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You realize, Norman, that we are all going to die. Norman is lying in his own bunk, below Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be so optomistic, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm completely serious.  There is something very important missing from that spacecraft.  You know what that is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sign that the builders knew time travel through a black hole was possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't follow you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On that flight recorder, they called the black hole an "Unknown Entry Event." They didn't know what a black hole was.  Fifty years from now, men are going to build that ship in a very tentative, experimental way, with no knowledge that time travel through a black hole is possible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what? Harry leans his head over his bunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, we know. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We know it went through a black hole.  We saw it.  Norman -- when we'd get to the surface, we'd tell someone about the black hole, wouldn't we?  It'd go in some report like some big discovery.  So in fifty years when they build that ship, they'd make precautions for a black hole. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they didn't.  The called it an Unknown Entry Event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning we're never gonna get the chance to tell anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meaning we're never gonna get to the surface alive... to tell anyone. Norman gets out of his bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe that, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme another explanation. Norman pacing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.  If I had a minute to think, maybe, but I know you're wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look -- we're under a lot of pressure, we're tired, you're not thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, you think I'm cracking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I didn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what, Norman? Norman stops pacing, a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's what's in that sphere, isn't it, Harry?  Whatever you think is in that thing -- you think it's going to kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curious, isn't it?  What's inside? Before I die, I'd sure like to open it and see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MONITOR: Video of the sphere.  RAPIDLY rewinding

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What caused it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  I don't know.  Everything was normal.  No changes at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did it happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seconds ago.  Here! PLAYBACK: WE SEE the sphere -- idle.  Nothing around it. slowly OPENS, revealing BLACKNESS inside.  A beat.  And t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see that again. Edmunds plays it again.  This time...  WE MOVE IN ON HARRY, staring at the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd sure like to open it and see. ON HARRY -- those cold, intelligent eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON PRINTER, TYPING: "... 30 knots -- ETD -- 00:19 m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- Norman and Barnes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get hysterical, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Harry's lost it. He's saying there's a deathwish out for each of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, the ships are clearing out. They're taking us topside in a matter of minutes.  Someone can check him out there, if it's that imprtant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I'm saying is, someone should keep an eye on him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just worry about yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes on the phone with the surface.  Ted talking to him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I stay, sir?  I'm willing to risk it.  I am.  After what we just witnessed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  No, I know they're civilians...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN -- gathering his things.  Stuffing his shotty d Beth, at her bunk, doing the same. Norman stands up.  Looks at the bunk above him: unpacked unpacked belongings, a notebook lying there saying: PROPE HARRY ADAMS. ON NORMAN -- panicking, looking around for Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I said send the subs down, damn it! Barnes out the door, Ted at his heels...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear me, sir, because --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, shut up.  Are you packed?  Ready to go?  I want everyone packed.  Now! ON NORMAN -- running at them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, he's missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's missing.  He's gone.  He left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's here somewhere.  Find him.  The sub's on it's way. (they look at him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go!  C'mon! Norman runs off.  Barnes storms down the hall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can he be missing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, about leaving --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on the bottom of the fucking ocean -- he can't just walk outside!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds working the monitors, stops.  Seeing something on Staring in horror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my gosh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, phone to his ear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a report, I want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and Gentlemen...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that?  Where's that coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please watch your closest monitor...  Barnes turns...  ON HIS MONITOR -- Harry, in jumpsuit and helmet, stands i SPHERE. Barnes quickly puts on his headset mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, Norman, Beth, Ted staring at the monitor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was with you, Norman. Through the speakers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get him out of there.  I thought I told you people --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into her mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?  Can you copy? ON THE MONITOR -- Harry, before the SPHERE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay close attention.  I think you will find this of interest. The sphere DOOR slowly opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is he doing? Harry steps up and into the sphere.  The door closes slow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINTER, TYPING: "... ETD -- 00:15 min"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman with Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me I told you so, Norman, because I don't want to hear it. (yelling past him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, I want everything by the door -- ready to go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MONITOR -- labled: "SUB DESCENT" -- it's still.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Subs are still at surface, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Send them, damn it!  I know, but I'm not gonna be held responsible -- Norman with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't just leave Harry down here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you people, nobody goes anywhere unless I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No "buts".  If he wants to be left, we'll leave him. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Yes, the subs -- I want a report...  Hello...  Yes, a report. Gimme... shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting no sub reading, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINTER, TYPING: "... ETD -- 00:13 min"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN -- staring at the monitor of the sphere, idle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any sign of Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck him. (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON MONITOR -- labeled "SUB DESCENT"...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I am still getting absolutely no reading on sub movement...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINTER, TYPING: "... ETD -- 00:11 min"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, a report...  Hello? Beth, inside now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not leaving without him.  Do you hear me?  We come down as a team, we leave as a team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you -- his mother?  Get Norman, I want everyone ready to go. (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, the subs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth rushes by Ted, carrying bags to the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?  Where's Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the bunks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth running in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?... Norman? Can't see him anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, do you have a 20 on Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, where the fuck is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the ship, sir. Barnes spins to see the monitor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? ON MONITOR -- Norman, in jumpsuit and helmet, running thr Barnes slipping on headset mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?  Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman running across a catwalk...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get your ass back here.  You have no authority whatsoever to be in there.  You hear me?...  Norman?  Don't go hero on me now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRINTER, TYPING: "... ETD -- 00:05 min EVACUATION IMMINEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, if the subs haven't left by now...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've left, keep watching!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir!  Sir, the door -- it's opening. ON THE MONITOR -- the sphere door, slowly opening.  Revea BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is he?  Damn it!  Can you see him? A still moment and then Harry tumbles out the sphere, and ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, squinting at Harry on his monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does he look?  Can you tell? Harry lies motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks... dead, sir. ON BETH -- in the hall, hearing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, running, blindly, through a hall, around corners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, get out of there now! Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the subs aren't here yet, sir --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, into his headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here.  Norman -- can you hear me?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN -- running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have time!  Get the hell out of -- Barnes' voice goes static, and cuts out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR -- flickering, losing power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're losing it. ON THE MONITOR -- flickering, fading, and all the lights SHUT DOWN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HARRY -- lying still, face down under the sphere.  Goe Checks Harry's LIFE SUPPORT BADGE.  Still blinking -- he' Norman, pauses, looks up, staring at...

dialogues.speaker: THE SPHERE
dialogues.text: Mesmerizing.  He can see himself, reflected in the swirli staring back at himself.  The door begins to open, closes open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark.  Ted, Beth, and Barnes wander throughout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened? The lights flicker back on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They switched us over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Internal power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE OCEAN FLOOR -- a cable falling from the surface, coil around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON their dufflebags piled in the corner by the door been left behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN A LONG CORRIDOR -- it's quiet.  WE PEEK insi cafeteria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surface ships will be back. After the storm clears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long will that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes speaks to the team (minus Harry and Norman)...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They told me about sixty hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long can we last down here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortably?  Seventy-two hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfortably -- what's that mean -- with oxygen?

dialogues.speaker: HARRY'S FACE
dialogues.text: Harry lies on his bunk.  He begins to slowly awake. WE BEGIN TO HEAR A SCRATCHING NOISE, like nails on a chal gets LOUDER as Harry comes to.  He puts his fingers to hi Norman stands beside, him writing in his notebook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  That noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like...  ANGLE ON Norman's pen -- as he stops writing, the NOISE s Harry sighs.  Norman looks down at his pen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, can you tell me about the sphere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you still doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember opening the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were all supposed to leave.  You weren't supposed to stay down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the door.  Do you remember how you opened the door to the sphere?... Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't understand about the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then explain it to me. Harry pauses, staring almost like a frightened little boy

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happens on page 87?  Have you ever read page 87?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 87 of what, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could never read that far.  I never wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That far in what, Harry? Harry doesn't say anything.  Norman waiting...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here, Norman.  It's too dangerous for you and the others to be down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth comes out from behind a vinyl shower curtain.  A tow around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth -- I wanted to have a word with you...  Barnes washes his hands at the sink, looking at her in th front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the door -- I asked you to back away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are procedures, Beth, that I want followed.  My procedures.  And considering what's going on, I want you to follow them very closely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forgive me.  I've never read the Navy manual.  I wonder what it says about bathroom and shower procedures. He walks to the door, then turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Beth, one other thing.  I'd like from now on for you to address me as Captain or sir in front of the men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A LONG CORRIDOR -- LOOKING into the cafeteria...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is eating at a table, seems more relaxed.  The team around him, eating too.  Beth, cold.  Harry sprinkles sal of food in the middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, go easy on the salt, will ya? We're not a bunch of icy streets here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salt's good for you, Ted.  Helps you from getting impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impotent?  I'm not impotent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off food)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These aren't half bad, Fletcher.  You might have a second career coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squid...  Harry stops mid-chew.  Frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... there was a whole flock of them out there earlier.  It's strange. It's dead down here, and then all of a sudden -- Harry drops his fork.  He begins COUGHING.  HACKING.  CHO GAGGING.  He HACKS out the squid from his mouth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long, empty corridor.  All is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MONITOR -- a series of numbers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did it come across?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Minutes ago.  Harry's trying to decode it in his room now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.  We have no surface support. It transmitted too fast to be coming from underwater.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it coming from our own computer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry thinks it's some sort of discharge from our own system, but I've seen it discharge before -- and it didn't look anything like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWARMS of pretty, pink JELLYFISH.  Everywhere. FROM UNDER THE HABITAT -- Fletcher swims up to them with beautiful.  Eerie.  Almost idyllic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, on his bunk with decoding papers in his hands, tur entering the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting anywhere with those?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's some sort of pattern here. It'll take a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you looked outside?  Jellyfish. Everywhere.  I hate jellyfish. (sits on the table)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, what happened in the cafeteria?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.  Don't psychoanalyze me.  I hate squid.  Period.  Just like you hate jellyfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something to me, before -- about how we were all going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't remember much.  It's like my memory is on the tip of my tongue -- but I can't taste any of it.  Funny, my senses are much keener though. Purer.  Hearing, seeing, smelling. Like, I can smell your sheets, Norman.  You tried to wash it out earlier, But I can still smell the urine. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, I'm not going to tell the others.  It's normal, really, isn't it?  In a crisis.  The stress. The panic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, Ted, and Barnes watch...  ON A MONITOR -- Fletcher outside, with the jellyfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher?  What are you doing out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're like pink snow, sir.  Sticky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She says jellyfish are a delicacy. You know, I never knew that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there.  I don't want anyone going anywhere outside, understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're warm.  I can feel the heat on my legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, I want you back here.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN
dialogues.text: Norman sitting on the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you inside that sphere, Harry? A long beat.  Harry becomes concerned...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?  Does someone else want to go inside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR -- Fletcher, the jellyfish clinging to her suit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see, they're smearing the faceplate.  My arms... the fabric...  Fletcher's suit tears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher, get away from there...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's burning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher!  Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't...  ON BETH -- bolting out of the room.  Barnes turning to he

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're eating through...  Somebody --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON FLETCHER -- UNDERWATER -- jellyfish eating into her pl faceplate... she's COUGHING, GASPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch...  ON THE MONITOR -- Her body twisting, contorting.  Her sui apart.  SCREAMING.  She convulses.  Her body falling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON -- Fletcher's face.  Cold, dead.  Eyes open.  Je her skin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MICROSCOPIC IMAGE of a jellyfish. ON NORMAN -- in the corner of the lab, inspecting a MEDIC

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this, Beth?  You taking valium? Beth, looking into the microscope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sedatives.  Whatever my mood calls for. Norman picks up a book, next to the kit: 20,000 Leagues U

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd this come from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The library.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have a library?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bad one.  It was the only book in there.  Norman, come here, look at this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you.  I hate jellyfish. Walking toward her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... when I was six, my younger brother and I -- we went swimming in the Pacific.  At my mother's beach house.  We both felt stinging, and when we came out of the water, he was wearing jellyfish head to toe. Killed him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My gosh, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about you?  What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me?  Well, I was wrapped in seaweed. It itched for a while, but I survived. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, do you find it... curious that we're seeing all this life down here.  Nothing, and then these enormous flocks of squid.  Then jellyfish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, I'd say no.  Everything's quiet now -- no ships, no divers, no electricity.  Makes sense.  But what's curious is -- these aren't normal jellyfish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean -- not normal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have six tentacles.  A new species.  And the squid too.  They had no stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew about the squid not being normal.  Before Fletcher went out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you didn't tell anyone? Beth, nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Why...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I'm not... I wasn't absolutely sure if... they --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are or they aren't.  Which is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?...  Wait.  Don't... why are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody said... Norman...  What?  Why are you looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth -- She backs away from Norman, knocking off a speciman jar, on the floor.  She starts breaking down. Norman watching her, falling to the ground, picking up th hurriedly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything wrong.  I didn't mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth. She's crying, glass in her hands.  She looks up at Norman nervous...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wouldn't go and tell the others, would you? Norman hesitates, goes to her, tries to hold her, but she away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate this place, Norman.  I want out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOKING DOWN -- at the room where Barnes was on the phone stands there now, hand on the knob. CLOSES it shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes sits, Norman in front of him, worked up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not paranoid.  I know Beth.  She can be drastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How drastic?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A while back, Beth and I -- we worked at the same university.  She was assisting a chemist there -- I forget his name -- doing research, experiments.  She was also living with him. (off Barnes' look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know.  And when she finished her work, he kicked her out, broke off the relationship, and published five papers -- all her work -- without any thank you or acknowledgement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She should've known better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She put a razor to her wrists a day later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)
