dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When was this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: '81, I think.  She tried again five years ago. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you should know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you knew this when you wrote your report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the time, I don't know, I thought putting her on the list -- it might help her career -- catch her a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knowingly recommended a woman with suicidal tendencies for a government operation --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and then brought her down here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I didn't know it would come to this --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- without a cautionary word to anyone. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Ted said something to me earlier.  I think he's right.  He said, "When you got a guy who -- if he wasn't here -- he'd be standing in the unemployment line, you gotta question if you got the right guy." ON NORMAN -- sweating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE MONITOR -- a series of numbers:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same as before, but the spacing's different now.  It's definitely nonrandom.  See...  Harry sitting at the monitor, shows Ted, Barnes, Norman, PRINTOUT of the screan -- indicating a pattern.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a single sequence repeated over and over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all very proud of you, Harry, but what the hell is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sphere.  Maybe the sphere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not hooked up to the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if it's a discharge --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not a discharge.  Right, Edmunds?  You said before, right?  So it's gotta be a message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the sphere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's inside the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it is a message, it's probably a substitution code.  I'll work on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'll work on it, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted, flat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, nervous, anxious -- with five or six printouts in hi Norman's ear in front of the sink...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's manic, Norman.  You know that? This reliance on Harry is misplaced. You hear me?  Totally misplaced.  He's overlooking things.  Obvious things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what? Ted hands him a printout...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not some fucking substitution code, it's a direct visual representation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean a picture?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a look.  I rearranged the numbers.  Put 'em up to the light. (Norman does)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.  Squint at it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squint harder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands him another printout)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is like nursery school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you see it?  It's a picture of the creature.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The creature?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the sphere.  Look, that's the vertical torso, three legs, two arms.  There's no head, so I'm guessing the creature's head is located within the torso itself, you know? ON NORMAN -- Ted's lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how about we wait and see what Harry comes up with?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, why not.  Give him the trophy. That pretentious son of a bitch.  You heard him, Norman.  All that "someone went to a lot of trouble, try again" bullshit.  And "impotent".  Where does he get off saying I'm impotent?  He's a fucking self-righteous, little prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON MONITOR -- spirals now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I asked myself, why would the sphere be using a code?  If you're trying to communicate, why use a code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Norman)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See?  No code.  What'd I say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Codes are for hiding information.  So it's making a mistake.  It's making a code without intending to.  I figured it's probably substituting numbers for letters...  Then I began to wonder what an alien intelligence would make of our keyboard.  And since we're getting spirals, I imagined the keyboard as a spiral.  So I translated it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's brilliant. Ted grimaces at Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... spiralling out of the center, you see: "G" is one, "B" is two, "H" is three, and so on... when I got the message.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the message?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to tell you.  It's strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you mean, strange? Harry picks up his yellow pad of paper and reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Hello.  How are you?  I am fine.  What is your name?  My name is Jerry."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes walks briskly down the hall, Norman with him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He translated it wrong.  "My name is Jerry"?  It's like "See Spot run."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The message doesn't show a lack of intelligence.  It's smart.  It's approaching us in a simple way.  Like you would a dog.  Holding out your hand, letting it sniff, get used to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I -- a dog, now? Barnes ducks his head into the Video Feed room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, get in here.  I need you for this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a minute, sir.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN COMMUNICATIONS ROOM -
dialogues.text: Barnes storming through the room, the others (minus Edmun the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a name.  A real name.  This thing's full name, rank and serial number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, I personally feel we should ask much more substantive questions --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not gonna explain in some damn report that one person died in a deepsat expedition so we could meet an alien named Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the keyboard, typing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, we have to see if he'll talk at all.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITOR
dialogues.text: The monitor BLINKS, reply:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Jerry's talking. Harry types -- "0002921 301321 0613182108142232"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "We are friends".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the friends crap, get a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Yes".  Good.  Now let's see if it'll switch over to English letters. "0032125252632 = Hello" Reply: "0032125252632 = Hello"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not talking, it's mimicking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him a chance.  He's speaking our language, not the other way around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (typing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good idea, Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. "0032125252632 = Hello.  Hello = 0032125252632" No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing? Reply: "Hello = 0032125252632.  0032125252632 = Hello."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ignorant.  The thing's ignorant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not ignorant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's pretending to be ignorant. Harry types "===" Reply:
Harry types "=,=" Reply: "7 & 7"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you enjoying yourself, Harry, because I don't know what the hell you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He understands me fine. Harry types: "Yes" Reply:
Harry types: "Hello" A long beat.  Reply: "I am delighted to make your acquaintance.  The pleasure mine I assure you." They stare, stunned, at the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he's polite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless it's an act.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should it be an act? "Are you the entity HECHO in Mexico?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mexico?  Where'd he get Mexico? "Are you the entity made in the U.S.A.?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't wait for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says it's a he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now, Beth.  Please.  I want to know who we're talking to before we start talking.  Where's Edmunds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not gonna know, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Harry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask him.  C'mon.  Say something. Harry types: "We are.  Who are you?" Reply: "We are"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell's that mean?  "We are" what? Harry types: "We are the entities from the U.S.A.  Who ar "Entities = entity?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to teach him plurals? Harry: "No" "You are a many entity?" "No.  We are many separate entities." "I understand.  Is there one control entity?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's saying, "Take me to your leader." He wants to know who's in charge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in charge. "Yes.  The control entity is Captain Harald Barnes"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With an "o".  Harold with an "o".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What -- you want me to retype it? Harry: "Who are you?" "I am one" "Where are you from?" "I am here" "Where is the location from where you began?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "From where you began?" That's not even good English. "I am from AWARENESS"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that, a planet? "Where is AWARENESS?" "AWARENESS is" "Did you make a journey?" "Yes.  Did you make a journey?" "Yes" "I make a journey.  You make a journey.  We make a journe am Happy."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great, okay.  Ask him about his weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's smart.  Let's talk about guns and violence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think weapons are important?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we should be careful. Consider his emotional response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to put him on your couch, Norman.  Grill him about his childhood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he uses a phrase like "I am Happy", I think we should think twice about what we ask him. "Do Not Be Afraid" The all stare at the screen, stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, can you understand what we're saying? "Every word" Norman walks up to the screen, close to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, can you read our minds? "Yes Norman" Barnes goes to the intercom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds, I want you in here.  Now. Norman focuses on the screen, staring. ON THE SCREEN -- blank. Norman concentrating, on the screen. THE SCREEN -- blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, are you there? "Yes, Norman"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We shouldn't talk here.  Shut it off. "I do not wish to Intrude"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We would like to talk alone. "I do not agree.  That is not possible.  I enjoy to talk

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we enjoy talking with you. "Let us talk now"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd like to talk with you more.  We admire your talents and your great power and understanding. "Thank you"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And in your great understanding, you know that we are entities who must talk in private -- with each other. "Do Not Be Afraid"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not afraid, we are uncomfortable. "Am I offended you?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all, we enjoy you very much, but we need to talk alone, without you listening. "I shall oblige"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. "But I am Not Happy"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry?...  "We'll be Right Back after a short break for these Messag Sponsor"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry?  Are you still there? SCREEN -- blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? SCREEN -- blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds?  Get in here.  I want to know exactly how this is being transmitted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not gonna know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She wired this system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If the technology of that sphere is advanced enough -- the way it functions is gonna appear to us like magic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't gimme that psychology bullshit, Norman.  Psychology isn't a science, it's superstition.  It's a bunch of soft, subjective theories without any hard data to back it up. With an intellect like this, emotions don't mean shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like showing Leonardo da Vinci a laptop computer.  He'd run screaming "witchcraft".  And you couldn't explain it to him, either. Modems, microchips, particle physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make stuff up, these emotional theories, just so you can feel important here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frankly, Ted, I'd be much happier if Jerry was just a cold, emotionless intellect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into intercom)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because if Jerry is powerful and also emotional...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Edmunds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... it raises a very serious question: What happens if Jerry gets mad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds?  Can you copy? An empty chair.  Edmunds is not here.  WE HEAR a repeatin THUMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edmunds? ON A MONITOR -- WE SEE her body, wedged in a light stand floating in the water, lifeless.  Her helmet THUMPING aga of the habitat.

dialogues.speaker: OUTSIDE THE HABITAT
dialogues.text: Norman and Beth, in jumpsuits and helmets, walk out from habitat.  Still HEARING the THUMPING.  They pause, lookin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coast is clear. They go to the south end of the habitat.  The THUMPING lo Norman climbs up the grid-like STANCHION, the support bea the habitat.  The BODY above him -- flapping in the curre against the wall. He climbs, reaching the body.  A BOOT swings, catches the air hose.  BUBBLES shoot out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, your suit -- it's leaking. The BOOT comes off in Norman's hand -- and the NAKED FOOT purple toenails, KICKS his faceplate.  Startles him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman.  Look at this. ON EDMUNDS' SUIT -- a long TEAR in the fabric, revealing FLESH.  Droplets of BLOOD float past Norman's faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her flesh has been macerated. Chewed.  I've never seen a bite like this before. Norman pulls her body out. Edmunds' FACEPLATE whips around -- and Norman SEES her st mouth open in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't feel her bones.  She's like a sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was crushed.  Feel her skin -- it's like sandpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What could have done this? WE HEAR A SENSOR: PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes at the monitors, Ted with him. PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sensors are picking up something outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Barnes flips a switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't register.  It's too big to image.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too big?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WHITE EGGS, the size of golf balls descend from above.  H them.  Beth catches one, inspects it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eggs. From inside their helmets...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You people need to hurry back.  The sensors have activated.  I don't think you're alone out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted walks with Norman and Beth...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes didn't know.  Couldn't get a reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has Harry spoken with Jerry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not that I know of.  Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Ted at the console...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, are you there? No reply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think Jerry has something to do with what killed Edmunds?  With what's out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.

dialogues.speaker: AN EGG
dialogues.text: Beth, scalpel in hand, is making an incision into the she

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking at the coating here, it's definitely marine invertebrate. Barnes, Norman, Harry and Ted stand around the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, until we know exactly what it is, nobody goes outside, understood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was Edmunds doing outside?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resetting the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What sub?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the dome hanger.  All our tapes are transferred to the sub.  It's on a 12 hour timer.  If someone doesn't reset the "delay" button, the sub ascends to the surface with the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If something should happen to us, the Navy will at least have partial records of what happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least our obituaries will be accurate.  That's reassuring. ON THE EGG -- splitting open.  A slimy pinkish-brown FLUI FETUS underneath. They cover their mouths from the smell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? Beth picks at it with forceps...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure.  I've never seen anything like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fucking biochemist, aren't you?  Can't you tell us something. Beth glares at Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, holding a piece of paper in her hand, pulls Norman pressing on him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... He lied to us.  He left us down here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Beth.  Don't make this personal.  He told me himself they were taking us back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he told you.  Think.  What was Barnes doing before they cut that cable loose?  He was on the phone. Except that cable is a thousand feet long, Norman.  They would've broken off communication with us four, five minutes before they cleared out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So who was Barnes talking to at the last minute?  Nobody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're jumping to conclusions, Beth. Don't get worked up --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Norman!  It's right here...  She shows him the printout in her hand, putting a flashli words, reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Although advised of risks, all personnel elect to remain down for duration of storm to continue investigation of alien sphere and associated spacecraft.  Signed, Barnes, USN."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In Edmunds' things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You went through Edmunds' things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not just a Navy captain -- he works for the fucking Pentagon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm down, Beth.  Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me to calm down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's done, alright?  It's over!  And there's not a damn thing we can do about it now, okay? He turns to leave...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said something to him, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him about me? ON NORMAN -- pausing, staring at her...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did, didn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, I didn't.  Hold it together. Alright? She looks at him, piercing into his eyes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.  Sure, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I should stay calm.  Like you say.  Right, Norman?  Stay calm. Norman looks at her, concerned, knowing she doesn't belie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fletcher and Edmunds are dead, Norman.  And the only one we can trust to run this place is a fucking liar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE OXYGEN REGULATOR -- bobbing up and down -- keeping little that's left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, Norman, Beth, and Ted are gathered around the mon addresses Norman...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want you talking to Jerry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir, I think it's imperative.  I think the messages, the animals we've seen, what killed Edmunds, the reading you got earlier -- I think they're all related.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry isn't hostile, Norman.  He said earlier -- we were his friends --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he did.  He's been isloated for 400 years.  He wants someone to talk to.  Look, you put a human being in isolation for four days, they can become neurotic, sometimes psychotic.  We're talking about 400 years here.  An alien that shows emotional responses.  I think we need to address him, before he reacts further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he killed Edmunds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.  Whatever's out there, I think is his response to us refusing to talk to him earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bullshit.  What's out there isn't alien.  It's an animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe so.  But I think we need to ask Jerry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I think we should shut down the communication lines inside the habitat.  He might be listening now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think he already is. They turn to the monitors:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work, Captain sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Beth.  I don't want to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, we don't want to ignore you. "Don't underestimate my power"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't. "Yes you do"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry -- THE MONITOR blinks back -- WE SEE the sphere.  It is clos WE HEAR the SENSOR: PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, alone, stares at THE FETUS on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE SONAR IMPULSE MONITOR -- lines jumping higher.  PO Barnes, Norman, Beth, and Ted watching it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? The MONITOR flashes: "I'm Not Listening" -- blinks back. AN OUTSIDE CAMERA FEED -- infra-red -- a large IMAGE stre

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Direction's east coming!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that? Barnes flips a switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going active.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It looked like a tentacle.  Of a squid. THE MONITORS -- BEEPING now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A squid?  The size of a whale?  I don't think so. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Target acquired.  Sixty yards. PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it attacks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty yards and closing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we use for defense?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a habitat.  Not a castle.  The only defense we have is High Voltage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Voltage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It sends 200 volts throughout the cylinder surface.  But we've never used it underwater before. PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forty yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you've tested it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  Each time it started fires inside the habitat. PONG.  PONG.  PONG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty yards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying -- we can't stop what's out there? THE MONITORS blink: "I AM COMING".  The monitor blinks to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? (bangs on the monitors)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It shut us down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry?  Please.  Stop this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, go into the control room. Listen for my instructions. Ted goes out the door. ALL THE MONITORS -- blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I -- ?  What the hell is going on here? They HEAR a metallic CLANKING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right beneath us. THE MONITORS blink: "I AM HERE".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looking at the FETUS on the table.  It suddenly SLI table. The room is rocked. ON SHELVES -- Jars, petry dishes, test tubes SLIDE off sh the floor.

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: TED is thrown ruthlessly against the wall.  His HEAD stri splitting open his forehead. THE WALLS -- CRACKING and GROANING. WATER breaks through a crack, spreading out onto the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?  Ted?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, stumbles, reaches for the headset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, we're leaking! Blood dripping from his forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Increase positive pressure!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our reserve air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's either that or we grow gills. BANG!  They grip onto the console...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, drousy, BLOOD gushing from his head, keeping balance for the PRESSURE GAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?  Ted, are you with me? Finds the GAGE.  Turns it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Increasing positive pressure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AIR BUBBLES burst out of the walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE FLOOR -- the WATER scurrying back through the leak

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes, watching the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's enough Ted. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut it off!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PRESSURE GAGE -- the needle RISING...  ON THE HEADSET -- in the air, dangling from it's cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted?  Ted! ON TED -- passed out on the floor.  Blood covering his fa

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Running.  BANG!  They're thrown against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE PRESSURE GAUGE -- rising, higher, higher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THUMP!  Norman and Beth, losing their balance, stumbling feet, running...  ON TED -- SLIDING out of the Control Room, down the corri the water. Beth grabs him, as Norman stumbles

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE CONTROL ROOM
dialogues.text: finds the PRESSURE GAGE, shuts it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG!  Barnes grips his headset as he's thrown to the flo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!  Norman can you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman grabs the headset, slips it on...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.  I'm here.

dialogues.text: You see the lever on the green box? Upper right hand corner? Norman sees it, reads it:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High Voltage Defense System. ON BETH -- in the hall, tending to Ted, looks up at Norma
