dialogues.text: You see the lever next to it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth yelling...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it, Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you see it? ON NORMAN -- turning from Beth, to the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't pull it, Norman.  It'll start a fire we can't stop.  Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it, Norman, it's the only choice we have.  This thing is gonna crush us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, don't do it! BANG!  The WALLS CREAKING and SCREECHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barnes on the floor, a MONITOR crashes alongside him, SPI flashing: "I WILL KILL YOU"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, sweating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now! BANG!  CREAKING, GROANING of metal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, please!  Don't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it, damn it! ON NORMAN -- puts his hand on the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman! He PULLS the lever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOWN THE CORRIDORS -- a loud HUM from the generators.  Th DIMMING. BANG!  WE HEAR what seems to be a SQUEAL, as the metal RE CREAKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ALARM SOUNDS. Barnes looks up...  THE WARNING BOARD lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire in Communications Room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE ROARS out from the walls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON FIRE EXTINGUISHER CASE -- Beth whips it open, gr ON NORMAN -- picking up Ted, lugging him awkwardly over h ON BARNES -- running down the corridor towards them. BANG!  Barnes falls to the floor, taken away by the water

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANOTHER CASE ON THE WALL -- whips open -- Beth grabs GAS hears...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help! She looks DOWN THE CORRIDOR at...  BARNES -- on the floor, flailing in the water, SCREAMING, are caught in a CRACK in the wall.  Desperate...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth!  Help, I can't -- ! ON BETH -- staring at him.  Just watching him.  Not movin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth! BARNES -- his body falling through the crack, his HEAD BA wall, stuck in the crack, water choking him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be-- ... trying to SCREAM, his NECK RIPPING, SNAPS, and his bo into the ocean. ON BETH -- cold, turns away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIRE blasts out from the wall...  BETH and NORMAN (still with Ted) wearing GAS MASKS, RUSH room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay low! Beth sprays WHITE FOAM on the fierce FLAMES, licking up t padding, smoke boils to the cieling. BANG!  The room is rocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't stop. Norman falls to the floor, losing Ted. TED -- SLIDES away and UNDER the computer CONSOLE. BANG!  The computer CONSOLE breaks -- COMPUTERS, MONITORS CRUSHING on Ted's legs.  He SCREAMS out in agony. NORMAN scrambles towards him through the smoke when...  THE CONSOLE catches fire, erupts in flame.  Ted underneat BETH -- her extinguisher out of foam. NORMAN -- runs to a wall, finds an EXTINGUISHER CASING, i can't get it open. TED -- reaches out in desperation as his LEGS catch fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman! NORMAN -- BASHES the casing in with his shoulder, grabs t extinguisher, turns...  TED -- his entire body on fire. BANG!  Norman falls, dropping the extinguisher -- it roll floor.  He reaches out -- can't get it. CLOSE ON TED -- his face burning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!  Nor-- BANG!  The lights go out.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: NORMAN -- watches in horror as he watches TED, lit in fla death. NORMAN -- reaches for the wall for balance, grabs METAL, ELECTRICUTED.  Falls backward, head first, and EVERYTHING

dialogues.speaker: BLACK
dialogues.text: A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Johnson?  Dr. Johnson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOCUS in on Norman, as he awakens.  NAVY SEAMAN, 40s, American, standing above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman Johnson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does this mean what I think it means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, sir, The storm has cleared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ships?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're topside.  We're ready to take you home, sir. The Navy Seaman helps Norman to his feet.  Norman is smil over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and the Navy Seaman walk down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are the others?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth and Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're in the sub, sir.  Waiting. Norman sighs, smiling.  The relief, the jubilation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That whole time -- I couldn't stop thinking of what Harry was saying earlier...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the time paradox. (the Seaman nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How we were all going to die -- that there was no way we would make it out of here alive -- As Norman looks up, the Navy Seaman, still walking and no to slowly DISAPPEAR.  Disintigrating.  VANISHING before h Norman stops, looks around him.  He's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman watches on a monitor -- the VIDEO of him walking d the Navy Seaman walking next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... how we were all going to die -- that there was no way we would make it out of here alive -- ON THE MONITOR -- the Seaman disappers. Norman stops tape.  Looks over at the MONITOR showing the closed. THE SCREEN goes BLACK.  Flashes up: "Hello Norman"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? "Yes Norman"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, did you create that man? "The entity Navy Seaman was a Manifestation.  Did you hav talk?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, are you manifesting what's destroying our habitat? "Did you have a Happy talk?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry, answer me. "No."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry? A beat. "Stop calling me Jerry" The MONITOR shuts off. Norman looks over at ANOTHER MONITOR labled "AIRLOCK FEED ON THE SCREEN -- Beth is putting on her jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REFLECTED IN THE POOL OF WATER -- WE SEE Beth, slipping o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going in such a hurry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to reset the sub. Norman stands in the doorway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bother me, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth the risk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's also our only way out of here! It holds three people.  And there's only three of us left now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, me and Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You, me and Harry.  He's asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wake him, then.  Let's go.  Get outta --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't.  The storm.  The waves would toss us around worse than we got down here.  And we have four days of decompression when we get up top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the helium out of our bloodstream.  We go to the surface now, we'd pop like a soda bottle. She begins to put on her helmet, when she stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should go.  To the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why should I go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should know how it works.  Just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you die, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't trust Harry to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would.  But my suit --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fixed your suit. She goes to it.  Brings it to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (watching her closely)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fixed my suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I don't know how --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You press a button, Norman.  It's not brain surgery.  Here, go ahead.  You only have 15 minutes to reset it.  Go on, Norman...  She hands him a BRIEFCASE, the tapes inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I'll watch the sensors for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman drops to the bottom with the BRIEFCASE.  Lands on BREATHING.  Checks his LIFE SUPPORT BADGE.  She must've f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're clear, Norman. He walks along, out from under the habitat.  Carefully, l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sub's a 100 feet in front of you.  You see it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see anything.  How does it look?  Still clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still clear. Norman, hesitantly, ventures out.  The DARK WATER.  Looki Anything could be out here.  Walking.  WE HEAR him BREATH BREATHING gets shorter.  He looks at his LIFE SUPPORT BAD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fixed this suit? (no reply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Norman.  I did.  You're just nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My air isn't... I'm coming back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.  Counter's at 10 minutes. You don't have time. His BREATHING is short, but managable.  He continues on. AHEAD OF HIM -- the DOME HANGER attached to a large, gray forty feet high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still clear. UNDERNEATH THE DOME HANGER -- Norman climbs up to the hat below him.  Nothing around him.  He SPINS the wheel, and HATCH OPEN.  Lifts himself up, awkwardly.  Grabs HANDHOLD himself up into the POCKET OF AIR trapped inside the dome THE SUB -- in front of him.  He finds the hatch, opens it the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sits in the small seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer.  He bangs at his helmet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth? He searches the sub's CONTROL PANEL.  Gadgets, switches, top -- a flashing red-lit BUTTON: "TIMER HOLD".  Punches flashing, and a small screen glows: "TIMER RESET -- COUNT It begins counting backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Hello? No answer.  He looks at the Control Panel: A VIDEO SCREEN with the choices: "DESCEND, ASCEND, SECURE

dialogues.speaker: THUMP
dialogues.text: The sub slightly SWAYS. Norman sits still, nervous. THUMP!  Harder this time. Norman looks through the GLASS WINDSHIELD.  Sweating.  Ca anything in here. BANG!  It SWAYS faster, harder, back and forth.  He grips

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth!  Beth!  There's something -- ! THUMP!  BANG!  He's thrown around in the sub.  He can't s tosses around.  He reaches for the doorhandle. BANG!  He looses grip, his legs fly up in the air.  The S over on it's side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth!  Shit! His HELMET BANGS into the glass, WE SEE his look of terro SPLASHING up from below. Then, EVERYTHING stops. The sub SWAYS to a still.  He sits quietly.  Waiting.  Li Reaches for the doorhandle, cautiously climbs out. Stands on top of the sub.  Keeping balance.  He looks aro DOOR inside the dome.  Tries to open it.  Locked. Looks around.  Nothing else.  Looks down at the water.  C His BREATHING short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Can you hear me? No reply.  He dips his leg slowly, quietly into the water Then, cautiously slips down into the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HIS FACE -- terrified.  Looking everywhere.  Sea see anything.  Lands on the bottom. His LIFE SUPPORT BADGE beeping.  Shortness of BREATH. He walks, trying to run, out from under the dome hanger. WATER.  Can't see anything.  Scared to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Beth?  Shit. THE HABITAT -- ahead of him. Norman goes to a STANCHION.  Grips onto it.  Twists aroun Searching.  Doesn't see anything.  LIFE SUPPORT BADGE ble Barely BREATHING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... you there?  Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't breathe...  Am I... clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're clear.  You see the airlock? Norman, twists around, and as he does...

dialogues.speaker: A SEA SNAKE
dialogues.text: HISSES at his faceplate.  Norman SCREAMS. ON HIS HAND -- holding the snake, not the girder, lets go

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman! Norman falls... looking up: The SNAKE wrapped around the slithering between the grid-like posts. THE SNAKE'S HEAD comes at Norman, as he falls to the ocea Backpeddaling on his arms and feet.  THE SNAKE, HISSING, It's long TONGUE flicking at him, inches from his facepla backpeddaling, can't BREATHE, the SNAKE coming down on hi falls on his back, the TONGUE WHIPPING across his facepla NORMAN is whisked up. HARRY has him by the collar of his suit.  Taking him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They burst out of the water.  Harry throws Norman onto th Unhooks his helmet -- Norman BREATHES, fast and furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, panting, walks with Harry...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.  My suit -- Beth said she fixed it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?  She's not here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I woke up, nobody was here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was supposed to be watching the sensor for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her suit's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth left?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought she was with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Harry at the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... what do you mean?  I'm in the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing in the ship? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting food.  We were out of food. what's wrong?  You sound mad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I get that way when I'm facing death and someone deserts me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deserts you?  Harry said he'd take over for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He what? Harry shakes his head: "no way".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When he woke up, he said we were out of food.  He told me to get some from the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did.  Norman, I wouldn't leave you out there.  You know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We never even had a conversation, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry?  That's bullshit.  We stood right there -- Harry covers the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's cracking, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't say that about the food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just in the cafeteria, there's plenty of food in there.  Take a look for yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why would she -- ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's lying, Norman.  Just like she lied about fixing your suit. Harry uncovers the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get it straightened out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so, Beth.  Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, sitting at a table, eating a couple pieces of col A salad, some fruit, and boxes of crackers on the table. Beth walks in, carrying a bag of food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's Harry doing with your suit in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fixing it?  But I fixed -- (notices the food)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where'd you get all that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refridgerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The refridgerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a pretty common place to look for food when you don't think you have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That wasn't in there before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We must've had it delivered then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1-800-Deepsea delivery.  I hear they're good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: None of this was here before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you look?  It was on the top shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it wasn't.  I swear none of this was here.  None of it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think he hid it?  Earlier.  He must've hid it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't believe me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I know is I opened that refridgerator --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Norman.  I swear.  I had a whole conversation with the man when he woke up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This being after you so carefully fixed my suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think it's me?  You think I'm saying there was a conversation when there wasn't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Beth.  I wasn't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Norman!  He's lying.  Don't you get it?  There is something seriously fucked up going on here -- and he's causing it.  Why can't you believe me? TO HER LEFT -- she looks -- HARRY is standing in a doorwa holding Norman's jumpsuit.  He turns away. ON BETH -- looking back at Norman, tears rolling down her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry neatly hangs Norman's jumpsuit under the hook lable Smoothens it out for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BETH -- sitting at a table, her face in her hands. ON NORMAN -- looking at her, as he closes a box of cracke cellophane over the chicken.  Walks with it over to the r Opens it, placing the chicken inside... but he can't.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE REFRIDGERATOR
dialogues.text: are BOOKS -- neatly lined up on each of the shelves. NORMAN -- backs away.  What the hell? Norman now looks at the CUPBOARDS.  Goes to them.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE CUPBOARD
dialogues.text: Books, neatly stacked. Norman, panicking, opens each of the cupboards, all of th BOOKS. All of the books are the same.  Entitled: "20,000 Leagues by Jules Verne." Norman looks over at Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Norman?  Norman? She comes to him.  He stands there, bewildered, scared, m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman? Norman paces, frantic almost, running his hands through h trying to think.  Stops.  Turns to Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 87.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page 87.  "I could never read that far." Norman quickly plucks a book from a shelf, turns pages, g 87.  Reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Our fisherman frequently see some that are more than four feet long. Some skeletons of squids...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... according to calculations of some naturalists, one of these animals, only six feet long, would have tentacles 27 feet long.  That would make a formidable monster." He looks up from the book, realizing something...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman? SNAPS the book closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON HARRY'S DUFFLEBAG -- Norman rifles through noteb pages. TEARS off the first Jerry transmission. Beth, standing at the doorway, keeping watch down the hal

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, what is it? Norman grabs Harry's YELLOW PAD OF PAPER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THEIR FEET -- scurrying through the water soaked corridor Norman ushers her into the Control Room.  Looks around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman SCRIBBLES on the printout, glancing at the yellow paper...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After the attack, a Navy guy woke me up -- I don't know -- I thought he was an illusion.  But I checked the tape, and Jerry said he manifested him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manifested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Created.  Brought to life.  I don't know.  But at the end, Jerry said, "Stop calling me Jerry".  And -- Norman stops, staring at the pad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He translated it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Norman picks up the pad of paper, reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.  How are you?  I am fine.  What is your name?...  My name is Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is walking towards the Living Quarters...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember when we first spoke to Jerry, Barnes kept asking for Jerry's real name?  But Harry never would?  He didn't because he was afraid the screen would say "Harry", instead of Jerry.  We weren't talking to an alien intelligence when we talked to Jerry, we were talking to Harry... or a part of Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, a part of Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When did the messages start?  The animals outside start showing up? After Harry came out of the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think, in the sphere --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He acquired some sort of power.  A power to manifest things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But how?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can the sphere do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Beth.  I'm not the fucking alien that built the thing. But it can.  When Harry came out of the sphere, he mumbled something about page 87.  How he would never read that far -- he was too scared to.  Then you found the book, remember in your lab.  Then in the cafeteria -- and page 87 talks about a giant squid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which I told Barnes was attacking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's his fear.  The squid.  He's manifesting his fears.  Making them real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why is he doing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He must not realize he is.  Like the Navy crewman -- Harry was sleeping then.  He must've manifested his dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His dream?  You can't control your dreams.  And you can't control your fears, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I mean, we've always believed we can think anything we want without consequences.  You ever read the Bible? (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It talks about our sinful nature, you know?  I mean, we can think, and believe, and desire whatever we want, but there's a part of us -- a shadow side, as Jung called it -- that can't be controlled.  It's evil. It's inside us.  It's what we are.

dialogues.speaker: IN
dialogues.text: It's dark.  Harry lies on his bunk, asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the part of Harry that's being manifested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be.  And if it is -- it's a part of him not even he can control. Harry opens his eyes, stares at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN -- a transmission comes across...

dialogues.speaker: "CQX VDX MOP LKI... "
dialogues.text: Beth and Norman watch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like some sort of code.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why would Harry go back to using a code?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Jerry, don't you? Harry leaning against the doorframe, enters the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jerry.  Right.  I said Jerry, didn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a hell of a mistake to make, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  Slip of the tongue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don't know how you could make that confusion. Norman watching them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisconsin's your answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wisconsin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (off screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Navy transmission.  They're sent from Wisconsin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we decode it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't have to.  Watch.  It'll do it for you. THE SCREEN -- jumbling it's letters until finally...

dialogues.speaker: "SURFACE SUPPORT VESSELS TO YOUR LOCATION ETA
dialogues.text: Norman and Beth smile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cavalry is on it's way. THE SCREEN -- "16:00:00"... it begins decending in count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In time for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just in time for what? Beth, nervous, tries to cover...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our habitat, I mean.  This place can't handle another attack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another attack? A long beat, as Beth stares at Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?  I'm not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staring at me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.  I'm not star--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you are...  Harry looks at both of them, suspiciously...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I miss something?  You two seemed to patch things up awfully fast. A tense beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just figured, you know, the three of us -- we need to... work together through this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that why the two of you went through my dufflebag? Norman glances at THE SCREEN behind Harry: "I WILL KILL Y

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE MEDICAL CABINET -- WHIPPING open. Norman quickly digs through the medicines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diphenyl parlene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something for burns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ephedrine hydrochloride. Beth at the computer, looking up the names...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's for motion sickness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valdomet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ulcers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sintag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A synthetic opium analogue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it cause drowsiness?  That's all we need.  To get him unconscious -- put him under.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing about drowsiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tarazine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tranquilizer.  Causes drowsiness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... and may also cause bizarre halucinations". Norman throws it on the floor.  Picks another...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riordan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antihistamine.  For bites.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it!  Chloramphenicol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Antibiotic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parasolutrine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you spell it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: P-a-r-a-s-o...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a soporific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Causes sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a sleeping pill?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... used as an anesthetic if given in combination with paracin trichloride... " Norman digs, finds paracin trichloride...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BETH -- mixing the medicines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading from the computer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "20 cc's of parasolutrine in combination with 6 cc's of paracin given IV produces deep sleep suitable for emergency surgical procedures... no cardiac side effects ... REM activity is surpressed... "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long does it last?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three to six hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just boost the doses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  Wait -- isn't that dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How fast does it take effect?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if it takes 20 minutes, Norman? What if it takes an hour?  And he can fight it off?  We can't afford that. Beth goes to the cabinet, grabs another medicine.  Norman she adds it to the mix...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  What are you doing? What do you want to do -- kill him? A beat...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To be on the safe side.  I mean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to kill him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's either him or us, Norman. Another attack, and we go down with this place. She fills the LARGE SYRINGE with the clear liquid mix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ever given an injection before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty years ago.  In residency.  I passed out.  You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only lab rats.  Here. She hands him the syringe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him the whole thing.  Hurry, before he wakes up. Norman looks at the syringe, like it's an assault rifle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where do I stick it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sleeps on his bunk.  The door to the room is closed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman spirals down the stairway from the lab.  Hurrying dark cafeteria, the syringe at his side.

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: shuffling down the corridor, nervously.  Glancing at the

dialogues.speaker: ROUNDS A CORNER
dialogues.text: and SEES in front of the Living Quarters...  TWO AFRICAN-AMERICAN NAVY CREWMEN -- standing guard of th Norman stops, hides behind the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman comes in...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's got Farrakahn's army standing guard.  What's plan B? Suddenly, BANG!  The room shakes.  Shelves fall.  Cabinet open.  Norman falls to the floor. THE COMPUTER MONITOR -- crashes down in front of his face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Beth running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry! BANG!  Water shoots through the wall.  Gushing out onto t walls CRACKING. ON HARRY -- running out of his room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what it is, Harry. BANG!  They lose their balance, still running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the squid!  Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what?  What are you -- ? BANG!  Another CRACK -- water gushing inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know damn well what.  You're doing it! Norman grabs Harry, pushes him up against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?  I'm not doing anything -- ! Beth takes the syringe from her palm, and STABS Harry in

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman and Beth sit at a table, sipping coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not believing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not sorry.  You're scared. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a psychologist, Norman.  You pride yourself on knowing when someone's lying to you, not telling you the truth.  And now you're scared ... because you're not sure you can tell anymore. ON NORMAN -- watching her, sizing her up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON HARRY -- lying on a STRETCHER in the corner, propped u and a blanket.  An IV in his arm. NORMAN -- at the console, stares at the MONITOR of the SP beat.  His reflection staring back at him.  He slips on t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you copy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON THE JUMPSUIT HANGERS -- the jumpsuit under the name "D HALPERIN" is missing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman at the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the sub.  Resetting the timer. Why? ON THE MONITOR -- Beth sitting in the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sphere looks different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, different?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grooves around the door -- they've shifted.  And the pattern -- the fluids -- they look darker now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's Harry? ON HARRY -- the IV in his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A MONITOR: "12:30:00"... descending in count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman pouring himself more coffee, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth's suit still gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry lying on the stretcher, still. Norman watching him from above, sipping his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: HEARS A SOFT BEEPING
dialogues.text: Norman goes to the console, sits.  Checks the monitors. the console, not knowing what it is. A FLASHING LIGHT on the Sensor Board.  Norman still doesn it means. THE MONITORS go blank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth -- The MONITORS flash up: "I AM COMING." Norman spins around, goes to HARRY -- lying still.  Norma Harry's wrist.  Checking pulse. Norman returns to the console, slips on the headset...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Beth?  Can you hear me?  Get the hell out of there. THE MONITORS boot up again.  Norman looks at the SUB VIDE the sub is gone from under the dome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Shit. No reply.  MORE BEEPING.  Panicking.  Bangs on the headse

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  I'm getting some sort of reading.  There's something -- He scans the MONITORS, looking for movement.  Anything. still. Norman turns to looks at Harry...  CLOSE ON HARRY'S FACE -- still. BACK ON -- NORMAN, sweating...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And whatever it is, it's not coming from Harry. Norman looks at the monitors: ON AN OUTSIDE CAMERA FEED -- a bright LIGHT blinds the SC Beth in the sub, moving along the habitat. The Sub's CLAW ARMS carry large RED BOXES.  The lettering isn't in focus. Norman squints at the MONITOR -- can't make it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  What is that?  What are you doing? The Sub's CLAW ARMS drops one of the BOXES, plumping it s muddy floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hear me?  Beth?  Can you copy? Get inside, there's something out there. ON ANOTHER MONITOR -- the Sub moves forward.  Churning up It stops again, and releases another box. Norman BANGS on the headset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it, Beth, I know you hear me. THE MONITORS blink: "I AM COMING FOR YOU" ON NORMAN -- breathing heavy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? ANOTHER MONITOR -- the Sub in view -- a closer view.  It last box.  Norman can read the lettering now: "CAUTION: T

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  C'mon.  What are you -- ? THE MONITORS flash: "I WILL KILL YOU"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit. Norman WHIPS off his headset, bursts out of his seat, OPE Searching for tapes.  Another cabinet.  Then another. A shelf labled: "SPHERE" -- all the tapes are gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's her. THE MONITORS flash: "I WILL KILL YOU" ON THE HEADSET -- resting on the console.  WE HEAR faintl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman?  Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman pushes Harry and his IV down the corridor.  Hurryi two of water on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A METAL CASE -- labled: "Captain Harold Barnes." Norman BANGS it against the wall, trying to bust the LOCK BANGING.  Breaks the lock.  Digs inside the case. Pulls out a GUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman pushing Harry and the IV stand.  Wheels him into..

dialogues.speaker: BATHROOM/SINK AREA
dialogues.text: Norman stops.  Turns off the main lights.  The room goes florescent LIGHT above the sinks stay on. Norman wheels Harry inside, places him by a wall.  Checks Norman goes to a STALL.  Steps inside.  Keeps the stall d still see Harry about 10 feet away. Norman looks at the GUN.  COCKS it.  Pinches his finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ouch. He waits.  Listening.

dialogues.speaker: A FAINT HIGH-PITCHED HISSING SOUND
dialogues.text: Norman looks over at the sinks. A FAUCET is on.  Water HISSING faintly from it. Norman ignores it.  Waiting in the dark.  Listening. ON THE FAUCET -- the water running. ON NORMAN -- looking at it.  Can't ignore it.  Tries.  Bu Norman walks quietly through the inch of water on the flo

dialogues.speaker: OVER TO THE SINKS
dialogues.text: The light above them on.  Norman turns the faucet off.  T But the HISSING SOUND remains. Norman looks at the faucet, queerly.  Turns it back on. The HISSING SOUND still there.  It isn't the water. Norman looks down at his feet...  THE FLOOR -- seems to be moving.  Something swimming in t CLOSE ON NORMAN'S PANTLEG -- a long, tubular SEA SNAKE sl inside his pantleg, HISSING.  His pants BULGING as the SN slides up past his knee.

dialogues.speaker: HISSING LOUDER
dialogues.text: As more SNAKES comes through the crack in the wall. NORMAN watches with horror in the mirror in front of him slithers up to his groin, and across the inside of his sh Another SNAKE begins WRAPPING itself around the outside o sliding up around his neck.

dialogues.speaker: WE HEAR FOOTSTEPS COME FROM DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: NORMAN, standing still, watches as more SNAKES crawl up h slithering around his arms, his shoulders, his neck, unde over his face.  Their forked tongues FLICKING and HISSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it, Norman? NORMAN looking in the MIRROR -- as Beth comes up behind h jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the time? Norman GLARES at her in the mirror.  His body STIFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to know the time of day, Norman.  Do you know? SNAKES covering his eyes, SLITHERING across his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through his teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your watch. A SNAKE flicking it's tongue at Norman's lips.  Trying to his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?  I couldn't hear you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes, my watch.  I almost forgot. She looks at her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendid. She begins grabbing the SNAKES off of him, carefully drop the ground.  SNAKES writhing in her hands, twisted around Shakes them off.  Some drop in the sink.  She bends out o the SNAKE inside Norman's shirt, MOVES back down the way Past his stomach, his groin. Norman HEAVES from his chest, VOMITS on the mirror...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A POT -- pouring a white, milkish DRINK into a c Beth walks it over to Norman, sitting at a table, looking

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isotonic glucose supplement. Norman looks at the cup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, drink it. Norman places the cup down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you? Beth takes a seat.  Stares at him.  A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's getting cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd really drink that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't think I put something in it, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You put explosives around the habitat, I can't imagine what you'd put in a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did do that, didn't I? A beat.  She picks up the drink, and begins sipping it. her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you feel about snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snakes?  What do you mean, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I afraid of them?  Not during the day.  Sea snakes are diurnal.  When the sun's out, they don't bite. Fortunately for you, I had on my watch. (off cup)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is quite good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they doing down here?  In the bathroom?  Suddenly appearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you fear them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you manifesting them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I was, then I would've had to have gone in the sphere, wouldn't

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the phrase -- "keeping up with the Joneses"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did you go in the sphere, Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same reason I put explosives around the habitat.  For defense.  For the power.  To protect myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against what?  Harry's unconscious. He's not a threat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he isn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can't manifest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why, Beth?  Why go in?  Why put out explosives?  Why manifest the snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I manifested the snakes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, someone did.  But it wasn't me, Norman. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was you.  You manifested the snakes. A long beat between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth you're losing it.  C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon -- what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lying --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I lying?  Are you sure?  Are you absolutely sure I'm lying? (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then explain to me about the jellyfish.  Earlier.  Why did we see jellyfish?  Harry doesn't fear jellyfish.  You do.  They're your fear, aren't they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the snakes?  You want to know about the snakes?  You saw one outside earlier, didn't you?  When you thought I had deserted you -- you were terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's when you went in the sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One lonely, terrifying sea snake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You manifested that, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I?  Or was that you? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were hiding in the bathroom -- all conspiratorially like you were -- you became frightened, didn't you?  Terrified.  Like you were with the snake earlier -- and suddenly you have snakes slithering all over the floor.  You did that, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I?  Or am I making so much sense that you're going insane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never went in that sphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't remember you did.  But I'm sure you remember running like some fucking hero to get Harry, don't you?  You remember that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember before you picked him up -- when you looked up at the sphere, you remember that -- when the sphere opened? (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  But you can't remember going inside, can you?  No, of course not.  Harry couldn't either, could he?  "Like everything's on the tip of my tongue", he said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, the message said Harry.  "My name is Harry".  My name isn't Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it isn't.  Your name is Norman. But your younger brother -- what was his name?  The one who was stung when you were younger.  The one that died. The one you couldn't save.  What was his name? (imitating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Mommy, we're going out to the ocean -- to go swimming." "But I don't want to go swimming, Norman.  I'm scared." "C'mon, Harry, it'll be fine, it'll be fun." (resuming)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You heartless fuck.  That's why you're so scared of the water, isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you were in that sub -- and that squid was attacking you -- are you sure it was the squid that was attacking?  Do you know?  "I can't get Beth on the radio.  I'm in this tiny sub on the bottom of the fucking ocean.  All alone.  Surrounded by all this water." Was it really the squid that was attacking you, Norman -- or was it something else -- one of your fears?  You never really saw what it was, did you? Norman stares up at her, frightened.  Is she right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not scaring you, am I Norman?  I hope I'm not frightening you.  The last thing I want to do is frighten you.  You feel okay, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not me, Beth.  I swear.  It can't be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "It's not me, Beth.  It's not me.  It can't be.  I'm not doing anything." Just like Harry said before I stabbed him with the needle. Norman looks at her palm -- SEES the NEEDLE in her hand. up, away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to, Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise what, Norman?  Tell me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I'd belive you?  Believe anything you might say now?  After you lied to me about telling Barnes about my past.  About my problems.  My problems.  Not yours.  Not his.  Mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't, Beth.  Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's either this... or I kill you. The GUN in her other hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth -- She comes at him, needle in hand...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's your choice.  Because it's not safe for you to be awake.  To be walking around.  To be thinking about things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not safe for you to be either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I care?  You think I care if I die? (almost laughing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would I put explosives around the habitat -- set on vibration sensors -- that can trigger automatically, if I cared about myself?  Would I? I've tried twice before, Norman, why wouldn't I try a third time?  I'm not thinking about myself -- No, Norman, I'm thinking about you.  Your safety. Protecting you from your own self. She lunges at him with the needle, missing.  He RUNS for STAIRCASE leading to the lab.  Norman grabs the handrail, climbing the stairs. Beth's at his feet, grabbing for his ankles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!  I'm doing this for you, Norman. He frantically crawls up the stairs, her grasping at his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman. Climbing, climbing -- round and round -- the STAIRS never He looks up: THE STAIRS -- expanding in front of him, strangely increa number.  He climbs, racing, PANTING.  Beth, right behind almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, Norman. She GRABS his ANKLE.  She raises the NEEDLE.  Norman turn the FACE. She WAILS, blood SPITTING from her nose. Climbing, climbing.  The STAIRS increasing above.  He LUN step, GRABS it.  Pulls himself up...

dialogues.speaker: INTO THE LAB
dialogues.text: Scrambling.  He stares down at Beth -- the GUN pointing a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman -- He SLAMS the HATCH DOOR, on top of her, BASHING her head holds the DOOR closed.  Trying to regain his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what I'm talking about, Norman.  Don't you see?  It's in you. This vindictiveness.  This rage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from the door, Beth. He slides a heavy FILE CABINET over on top of the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Norman, I don't want to come in...  The door's METAL PIVOT turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON BETH -- on the stairs, spinning the door's WHEEL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I want to lock you in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman staring at the wheel.  CLICK!  It's locked from th Norman falls to his knees.  PANTING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON A SURVEILLANCE VIDEO CAMERA -- in the upper corn room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a psychologist, Norman.  You of all people, don't want to admit to your shadow side...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON A MONITOR -- WE SEE Norman -- sitting in a corner of t staring up at US.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... You have a professional stake in believing in your own mental health, don't you?  Don't you, Norman?...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, huddled on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you're going to deny it. You want to blame someone else.  You want to blame Beth.  Because you hate Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't fuck with me, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not fucking with you, Norman. You've fucked yourself. Norman JUMPS up, looks at the ground -- WATER on the floo level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn off the water, Beth. The entire floor is covered in water, rising higher, and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're frightened, aren't you, Norman? Norman, WADING through the water, searching...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is it coming from, Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you know? Rising higher...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth, stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop what?  Don't blame me.  It's not me. Norman frantically checking for a crack, a leak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where's it coming from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From you, Norman.  From your mind. You're doing it. It's up to his waist.  He climbs on top a lab bench.  Put his temples, straining.  WE HEAR Beth laughing. A SPECIMEN BOTTLE -- EXPLODES right next to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no ventalation in the room, Norman.  The pressure's going to kill you. Another BOTTLE SHATTERS, shooting fragments of glass acro

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's you, Norman.  Your fear of drowning.  You have to face it. Microscope lenses CRACK.  Bottles, Test Tubes, Dishes EXP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Norman.  Let me put you under. Before you kill yourself!

dialogues.speaker: SHATTER
dialogues.text: Bottles floating in the water POP!  The water too high -- swimming in it now, keeping afloat.  His FACE strains fro pressure.  He looks at the CAMERA in the corner...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Norman. Next to the CAMERA, he SEES the HATCH DOOR in the ceiling

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't even think it.  You don't have your suit, Norman.  The water will freeze you. He reaches up at the door.  Can't get it.  The water risi down in the water...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swims to a cabinet near the floor, OPENS it, searches, floating out -- AN OXYGEN CYLINDER and MASK -- he GRABS i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN'S FACE -- bursts above water level, slips on the m

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't help, Norman.  Your body is boyant.  You're gonna shoot right to the surface and explode, Norman. Don't you get it?  It's over. He BREATHES a last breath, reaches up to the ceiling HATC it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, what are you doing!  You're insa-- The DOOR opens and WATER gushes inside.  He grabs the fra door, and his body shoots up through the hole...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His body upside down, his hand holding onto the frame.  H next to it, pulls himself hand over hand, along the pipe. HIS FACE -- straining from the freezing chill. MOVING along the pipe, hand over hand.  He loses grip.  H upwards. CLOSE ON HIS RIGHT HAND -- purple, frozen, holding onto t Barely gripping. HIS FACE -- his eyes fluttering.  He blows air from his m burst from his lips. HIS BODY slightly descending. HIS LEFT HAND -- grips the pipe.  He continues on. HAND OVER HAND.  Pulling himself...

dialogues.speaker: UNDER THE HABITAT
dialogues.text: He SEES the airlock in front of him. He SCOOTS along, but slower, now.  He stops.  Can't conti his hand to his CHEST, it's burning.  He SEES the airlock fluttering, he's losing consciousness.  He can't do it. of the pipe. FLOATING UPWARDS -- is he gone? HIS HEAD -- BANGS into the habitat floor.  His body flat Being sucked upwards against it. He pushes forward... trying to grab the floor with his ha inches from the airlock. Plants his feet against the wall -- and pushes forward. SUCKED UP and away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... His head BURSTS above the water level, BIG BREATH.  G flails his arms over to the ladder.  Grips the ladder, bu are like ice.  Can't hold it.  He slips. Flailing in the water. He HEAVES his chest over the METAL RIM.  Twists his legs the water, and flops his body onto the deck. Shivering. Tries to get up.  Falls over.  His body shaking.  His lip eyes barely open, looking at...  HIS JUMPSUIT -- hanging on the wall. Norman crawls toward the suit, his body shaking violently out for his boots on the floor.  Can't grip them.  Inches toward his suit, tries to BITE at his suit, but his TEETH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're doing, Norman. But you can't save yourself. He grips the wall, his hands pulling him up.  He RIPS his hanger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Norman.  It's all over. Slipping on his suit, he HEARS a MAN'S voice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your attention, please.  Your attention, please.  All construction personnel clear the blast area now. Tevac explosives are now activated. Countdown beginning.  Mark 15 minutes, and counting. ON NORMAN -- as he slips on his helmet, his teeth -- chat

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE AIRLOCK HATCH DOOR -- Norman trying to open

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through Norman's helmet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Locked.  Don't try, Norman.  You can't get in.  I won't let you in. Norman turns, dives back in the water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman swims out from under the habitat.  Looks around at cylinders, the walls. Goes to the outside of a WALL.  Looking for a CRACK, a LE TO HIS LEFT -- Barnes' body, floating, hooked to the wall Norman goes to him.  SEES the CRACK. Climbing inside.  Struggling through the CRACK, careful n suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flooded to the top with water.  Completely filled.  Norma through the crack.  MOVES down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: A BOX OF CORN FLAKES
dialogues.text: floats by his faceplate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, where are you?  I can't see you, Norman.  Tell me where you are. Norman pulls at the cylinder's HATCH DOOR.  He HEARS fain his helmet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve minutes, and counting. He OPENS the door.  Slips inside, the water going with hi

dialogues.speaker: BEEP
dialogues.text: A SCREEN -- flashes: "D CYLINDER HATCH DOOR -- OPEN" The CHAIR in front of the console -- spinning, empty.  Be

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman closes the door.  Runs.  Down the corridor...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman ducks inside. THE STRETCHER, the IV -- empty.  Harry's not there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON NORMAN -- running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eleven minutes, and counting. Please evacuate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?  Can you hear me? (no reply)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman runs inside...  The chair, stopping it's spin.

dialogues.speaker: BEEP
dialogues.text: THE MONITOR -- flashes: "B CYLINDER -- DOOR OPEN". Norman's out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, running.  SEES the B Cylinder door.  Goes to it. OPENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman climbs inside, takes off his helmet. THE CYLINDER -- a maze of pipes and equipment.  Heaters, wires everywhere.  Difficult to see.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH PIPES
dialogues.text: WE SEE NORMAN -- walking through the cylinder.  Holding h his hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave me alone, Norman. He goes to her voice in the back.  Past pipes, equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that. ON BETH -- huddled in the back corner, wedged among pipes red.  Holding the GUN in her hand.  Pointing at Norman as through the pipes. ABOVER HER HEAD -- a computer SCREEN, reading: "DETONATIO 09:32"... descending in count. Norman stares up at the SCREEN, concentrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't stop it, Norman.  You can't fight me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.  You're too strong, Beth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please, don't shrink me, Norman. Not now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me about me.  I already know too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth -- gimme the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure.  Here.  Anything else, Beth can get you?  Some more chicken, perhaps.  Let Beth check the fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top shelf, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get out of here, Beth.  Let's go home. She sees HER REFLECTION on a PIECE of BROKEN GLASS on the puts her fingers to her matted hair, tries to comb it. Over the intercom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine minutes, and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Beth. ON THE GUN -- WE SEE Beth's wrists.  The two scars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over, Norman.  Go on, get outta here. Norman walks toward her.  Beth freaks...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?  What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away -- BAM!  From behind her -- Harry -- WHACKS Beth across the WRENCH, sending her to the ground. Norman goes to her, checking her pulse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I kill her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could hit her a little harder. More toward the cranium. Norman stares at the NUMBERS on the SCREEN above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she's still conscious, you can't fight her.  You can't stop the numbers. Over the intercom...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Killing her's the only way --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!  Look!  We didn't kill you, alright?  And believe me Harry, I would've found great pleasure in bashing your head in. Norman RIPS off a piece of her t-shirt, ties it to the wo her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me lift her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, carrying Beth in his arms, races awkwardly down t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're never gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and open the door. Harry does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, in his suit now, helps Norman slip on Beth's boots jumpsuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much time you figure to get to the surface?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two and a half minutes.  Once we're in the sub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little less than six minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman carrying Beth on his back, hurries through the wat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: UNDERNEATH THE SUB'S DOME HANGER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry!  I'm gonna have to lift her up to you. Harry leans down from the Sub's airlock...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't reach her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.  Shit.  Here -- catch her. He flops her up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you trying, damn it?  Just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four minutes and counting. Norman loses grip, drops her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry, Norman.  Four minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I heard!  I heard! Picking her up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up and catch. Norman flops her up once more, and Harry grabs her AIR HO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here, I'll... wait, you -- just give her to me. Norman takes Beth and pushes her on top the sub.  The sub and forth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman, what are you -- They lose balance, Beth almost falls, Norman catches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.  Alright, Harry, get in there. Harry jumps on top of the sub.  Slides inside it.  Reache catching Beth's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take her, come on.  Just -- Beth's LEG swings up and hits Harry in the helmet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to keep balance with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme a second --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just pull her -- down like inside -- Harry, work with me here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying.  There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman in the seat.  Beth's leg hangs over his right shou looks at Norman who assesses the flight controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to work this thing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, press something!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two minutes and counting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long did you say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.  Let me think. Norman presses a button. THE SCREEN -- blinks: "DESCEND, ASCEND, SECURE, SHUTDOWN. Norman hits "ASCEND".  The Sub WHIRRS, RUMBLES and drops Norman works the steering wheel, gliding it upwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I don't.  But I always said to myself, when I die, I want to die laughing. Harry laughs. Ascending... waiting... and then...  A THUNDEROUS EXPLOSION below them...  Rocking the sub, spinning it up and around, surging it up surface. THROUGH THE WINDSHIELD -- RACING toward the surface, towa SUNLIGHT -- it's BLINDING -- and the screen GOES WHITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pale, white room. ON NORMAN -- sleeping.  His eyes begin to open.  He awake BETH -- is next to him, looking at him.  There is a long

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his head)

dialogues.text: The Admiral's going over the tapes they brought up now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does he know yet what really happened down there? Looking INSIDE -- Norman, Harry, and Beth sit at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the table...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're going to want answers and they're going to keep asking until they get them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can refuse to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Won't make any difference.  The tapes document everything. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is one possibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We all kill ourselves? (laughing, then)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad joke.  Sorry, Beth. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The power allows us to manifest our fears, right?  What if we feared the power to go away?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean forget?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would erase all our knowledge of it.  All of our power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would it work?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.  And I think we already know it will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down below, Harry said we would all have to die.  Since there was no evidence on that spacecraft that anybody knew time travel through a black hole was possible -- and we all knew -- then we would all have to die before we could tell anyone. Death was the only logical explanation.  But sitting here, we still know.  So how is that possible? (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we make ourselves forget.

dialogues.text: Did you say something about a squid, Harry? Harry shakes his head.
